Ingredients.3: 0.5 cup all-purpose flour, plus more as needed

Ingredients.4: 1 cup marinara sauce, heated, or more as needed, divided

Ingredients.5: 1 Freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, for serving

Directions.1: Place potato in microwave and cook on high setting until cooked through, about 7 minutes depending on the size of the potato.

Directions.2: Split potato and remove flesh. Push flesh through strainer using the back of a wooden spoon in order to achieve a granular texture. Add a pinch of salt and let cool for about 10 minutes. Pour in beaten egg and stir, using the tines of a fork and trying not to mash the potato. Add about 1/3 cup flour and continue gently stirring gently with the tines of a fork until mixture starts to come together. You may need another pinch or two of flour. Fold mixture with a spatula until dough forms a mass, adding flour as needed. Using your fingers, knead dough gently to form ball, about 10 seconds.

Directions.3: Shape dough into a fat log shape on a floured surface. Cut into 4 pieces. Gently roll each piece using your fingertips to form the snake or a long rope of dough, starting from the center and rolling toward the end until dough is about 1/2 inch thick. Cut each rope of dough into 1/2-inch pieces.

Directions.4: Roll each 1/2-inch piece quickly down the back of a fork's tines to form ridges.

Directions.5: Heat sauce in a skillet while you cook the gnocchi.

Directions.6: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Reduce heat so water continues to simmer. Add gnocchi to water. As soon as they float to the surface after half a minute or so, cook for an additional 14 seconds. Transfer cooked gnocchi with a slotted spoon to the pan with the sauce. Stir until coated.
